patterns: are you having any knowledge about corona virus
responses: Coronaviruses are a family of viruses that range from the common cold to MERS coronavirus, which is Middle East Respiratory Syndrome coronavirus and SARs, Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus. The spread of corona virus started form a city of China, Wuhan.

Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by a newly discovered coronavirus. Most people infected with the COVID-19 virus will experience mild to moderate respiratory illness and recover without requiring special treatment.  Older people, and those with underlying medical problems like cardiovascular disease, diabetes, chronic respiratory disease, and cancer are more likely to develop serious illness.

patterns: how can we prevent the disease
responses: Preventions include: 1. wash your hands regularly, or clean them using hand sanitizers. 2. Maintain at least 1 metre distance between you and people coughing or sneezing. 3. Avoid touching your face. 4. Practice physical distancing by avoiding unnecessary travel and staying away from large groups of people.

Well, till date there is no vaccine available in whole world, but soon we'll be ending this bloddy pandemic.  Many countries started their pre-medicals tests of the vaccines prototypes.

patterns: How corona virus transmits from one person to another
responses: People can catch COVID-19 from others who have the virus. The disease can spread from person to person through small droplets from the nose or mouth which are spread when a person with COVID-19 coughs or exhales. These droplets land on objects and surfaces around the person. Other people then catch COVID-19 by touching these objects or surfaces, then touching their eyes, nose or mouth.

patterns: what is the incuation period for corona virus
how much isolation period is required
responses: Most estimates of the incubation period for COVID-19 range from 1-14 days, most commonly around five days.

patterns: is corona virus same as sars
responses: SARS was more deadly but much less infectious than COVID-19. There have been no outbreaks of SARS anywhere in the world since 2003. The virus that causes COVID-19 and the one that caused the outbreak of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) in 2003 are related to each other genetically, but the diseases they cause are quite different.

patterns: who is at risk of developing serious illness

which age group is more prone to this disease.
responses: While we are still learning about how COVID-2019 affects people, older persons and persons with pre-existing medical conditions (such as high blood pressure, heart disease, lung disease, cancer or diabetes)  appear to develop serious illness more often than others.
